review: I LOVE red robin for many reasons. They have a wide selection of items so you're definitely going to find something that sounds appetizing.  They offer bottomless fries which is always great.  Their burgers are DELICIOUS! I always try a different one when I go and it's a great place to bring friends and family. Their salted caramel milkshake blew my mind. Their onion rings appetizer is really great for sharing and so are their Chinese ribs (I think that's what they were called).  If you visit red robin a lot make sure to sign up for their loyalty program to take advantage of their great offers

We've been here two times, the good was good in one of them and quite bad in the other.  Service and the atmosphere were always good. I really enjoyed the Smoke and pepper burger. On the other hand, the mushroom burger was very soggy and unappealing. My wife ate the gluten-free burger, which was just ok. Their GF bun is not too bad, but it's difficult to find a GF burger sauce.

Our family's experience at this Red Robin site was terrific! We just moved here from the Seattle area and are used to our local RR (in Redmond, WA). I was skeptical that this downtown site would be as good as our old hometown site that we know and love. We were pleasantly surprised: this RR was definitely as good or perhaps even better than our old hang-out in the States! We opted to walk the stairs to the outdoor patio deck, as it was a hot and sunny day. What a great outdoor venue up here! And our server was the nicest guy EVER (damn if I can remember his name, though. He was from Bellingham, WA, though, so we chatted a bit about  Seattle and Washington state).  We loved how our American RR rewards card (and all our points) were transferable/usable here in Canada, too. Much of the menu was the same (which is a good thing!), including their bottomless fries and refillable freckled lemonade. There was a lovely girl who kept bringing my kid more fries and lemonade before we even asked her. The server staff here was incredibly on the ball. (The only difference I recall on the menu was the addition of poutine here. My kids thought that SO cool! We didn't order it, though; it will have to wait for next time). Love the fact that they still offer the free birthday burgers here. Oh, and I opted to have a salad which was definitely larger and, dare I say it, better than the RR salads back in the States. (Our American RR restaurants "updated" their interiors and their menus the past few years and the salads were changed - not for the better, IMO. But here they were as they used to be back home: larger, fresh, delicious. Easily shared by two people).  Great place for families. Great menu. Great patio. Great service (super nice servers). Great reward program. Great location downtown. Just.....great!

Went with a friend to redeem my Red Robin Royalty free birthday burger (comes with the usual bottomless fries!). As I was feeling like I had had too much meat recently, I went for the Garden Burger which, sad to say, is just OK, and that's if you immediately take out the pickles so you don't just taste pickles. Do NOT come to Red Robin for their veggie burger even if you do a patty swap. For approximately the same price (sometimes LESS) you can get a way more interesting and tasty burger (but with a meat patty). Contrary to my way-back-when experience, to redeem my birthday burger all I needed to do was give them the phone number attached to my account and confirm which burgers were part of the promo. No fuss at all. However, my friend got the Veggie Fajita, and OMG it was totally not what we were expecting -- in a good way. Generous almost for-two portion for $14.99, and although they start you off with about 4 wraps, it is clearly not enough and you can get free refills. Veggies are cheap (it looked like mostly onions) and clearly they don't skimp on it maybe because they can. NON-alcoholic drinks are big-portioned and cheap! My Coconut Pineapple Smoothie was just $4.69 and pretty tall. Heck, even the water is jumbo sized so they don't even have to come around and refill it because you are unlikely to drink it down to even half. Cronuts are OK, though sweet and a bit oily-feeling so personally I don't like them much. The main thing about them though is they are light and airy. If you are thinking of trying them but feeling full, just get the short 4-stack and you'll be fine as there's no way they are gonna fill you up. Friendly service, great value

#BringBackChainRestaurants!!!! Considering VanCity is very hippie-dippie with its obsession with organic, 'gluten-free', picture-friendly foods, good chain restaurants like RedRobin is dying out. Their burgers are great! The bottomless fries are thick & well-done! The bottomless FreckledLemonade is a classic! This used to be THE spot to go... now their burgers seem slightly smaller with an interior that's not properly maintained... sticky tables & unclean cutlery etc... But I have hope! The SriRachaDouble was excellent!!!! The service was friendly & the price is always decent!

Came back for free burgers! and thats really the only reason why...but we got the chicken california burger and the whiskey river burger! shared between the two of us and it was tasty, service was pretty quick (it was kind of empty) and we received our free ice cream sundaes too! the california chicken was my favourite because the avocado and chicken made for a great combo while the bbq sauce wasn't too obvious in the whiskey river and onion strings got lumpy fast!  Got the caesar salad side (standard, kind of boring) and bottomless fries of course.

Good burgers. Their new line up of burgers are not as good as their classic ones. I'd stick to the classics. The place is a bit stuck in a time gone by, but I think it still has a faithful following. I hope they don't go away. The Broadway location shutdown.

This is my second time at this location. The service was amazing this time around. Our drinks were refilled at a timely manner. Our food did take a bit long but it tasted better than the last and possibly better than the first time I tried RB. We came for the Tavern Tuesday which is buy two beverages and a burger, entree or entree salad and get a double double tavern burger free.  We ordered: Popping purple lemonade (3/5-$4.69): They use their famous tornado glass to serve this drink and it was pretty. I'm not a huge lemonade fan but it'll do. It's more on the sweet side than sour. Raspberry syrup is used, hence the purple. Raspberry cream soda (3.5/5-$4.69): A bit sweet but it liked that they actually add some whipped cream with a cherry on top.  The big sky (4/5-$17.69): A bit pricey but it tasted   was served in a ciabatta bun, had an onion ring, bacon, the patty and goat cheese. Not sure if I missed anything else that was in there. It's a bit smaller than I expected too.  Bleu Ribbon (4/5-$12.69): My go to burger at RB. Didn't know blue cheese would go so well in a burger. But I remember requesting for blue cheese in my burger elsewhere and it was awful so RB it is if I want this kinda burger.  Double Double Tavern (3/5): Reminds of a McD cheeseburger but then again I haven't had McD since I was a kid so.....this is how far my memory goes. Not a bad burger. You do get double patties. Not sure if it's worth the deal though. You might as well get this if you plan to order drinks and you don't mind simplicity.  --- First time: Onion Ring Tower (3/5): I know a lot of people raved about this but other than it's served in a tower, I didn't see or taste anything different from the onion rings at another place.  Mad Love Burger (2.5/5): Can't quite remember what was in this but it was limited edition and my friend decided to get this. All I remember was it didn't taste good and was on the dry side. Don't see this on the menu anymore.

Very disappointing.  After having a great experience in Bellingham, we went in expecting the same. Sadly it wasn't meant to be.  The elevator up to this location is dirty and sketchy, although the location is great. We just had to wait a few minutes before being seated.  The server was quick to offer us drinks. They were out of the beer special. So they offered another kind, and my husband decided to go with that. My cocktail was overly sweet, and couldn't really taste any alcohol.  I ordered the steak fajitas. I asked for no onions, and was told that it might not be possible. I said if not I would pick them out. My husband ordered the Bonzai burger with the bottomless fries.  The fajitas came and they were over 60% onions ! The green peppers were actually grey, and the steak was awful. I could totally tell this came out of some sort of frozen package, it was defiantly not fresh - I guess this is the reason they couldn't take the onions out. When I told the server, she asked I I wanted to order something else. I did - and that too contained onions as well ! I was so mad at this point. A manager came over. She ended up taking both items off the cheque and comping my drink, but I left still hungry and completely frustrated !  I don't know how or why this place went downhill so bad. #neveragain

I have gone to Red Robin for dinner with my friends and co-worker couple times. We had dinners in different locations every time but most were the downtown branch.  It was always super busy and had to wait for a table. I remembered we had to wait about one hour to get a table one time. So, you should go there early before the lunch/dinner time. Once we sat down, service was pretty good and fast. The restaurant is large and has lots of space inside. Once we sat down, service was pretty good and fast. The menu looks very fancy and easier to order food by looking at the colorful image on the menu. The food came very fast. They were fresh and tasty with large portions.  Prices are reasonable. Their Burgers were my favorite and they were very juicy. The French fries were great too. You can free fill anytime you want.Very enjoy my dinner at Red Robin.

If you like to good old american style burger, then Red Robin at Robson is a good place to hit up. This chain has been here for a while and is suprisingly very busy considering most Vancouverite likes the traditional small unique restaurants. My experience here has always been great. The vibe is cool, the service is fast and the food is good. Let me elaborate. Vibe: Restaurant full of knick knacks as decor. Visually appealing. TV's all over the place, you can always catch the game. Lots of windows seats perfect for oeople watching while waiting for food. Service: I had several bad service, fries came out wrong and water was not refilled on time, and just slow service. Could be based on short staff but ill be a harsh critic. Food: Here is the best part. Lots of choices! I'm a simple guy who likes a simple burger. I've gotten the grilled chicken and the red tavern burgers. Both were so delicious that I've devoured it in a few bites. But thats not the best part. The regular fries or the garlic fries are super awesome! Crispy fresh, well seasoned and unlimited, it's really what brings me back to this place. Overall, my experience here has been A+. I always recommend anyone to try it out. It's not for everyone but it is for me.

Conveniently located in the heart of downtown Vancouver near shopping area, I came here to redeem my birthday reward from being a member of their rewards program!  The burgers red robins serve are huge and super delicious! I always find myself not being able to finish and having to take out at least half of my burger. Fries are bottomless and can be refilled as many times as you want which is a huge plus. I love adding their signature red robin powder on the potato wedge fries. It has a unique taste to it - a sweet BBQ kick! I tried the pacific wild salmon burger and was very satisfied as the salmon was not too dry and still soft. There was just a bit too much sauce in my opinion, but other than that it was good.  Restaurant has an old vibe to it and service was exceptional! The waiter serving us was very nice and even refilled our fries without us asking.  Will definitely come back to try the other gourmet burgers!
Great food and not bad price point. Friendly staff and the fries were bottomless. We will be back.

Nice service here A cheeseburger and onion rings I ordered are very good!! :) I will try some dessert menu later. It is because someone beside me oreder a cake and a some beverage that I don't know the name, those look so yummy!!!

I have visited this location of Red Robin again after a very unpleasant experience. This recent experience was much better and was more enjoyable. Had the same thing as before but was much warmer and enjoyable than previous.  I might have just gone on a one off night before but seems like this place is A-OK now :)
Great modern junk food.(in a good way) Good choice of drink, specially beers.  We've been served by Tom, who's a great professional and a funny guy.  Good place to have a good

My wife and I ordered takeout from red robin last night and were seriously disappointed. We ordered a salad, a burger and a spinach dip appetizer as well as a French onion soup. The salad came with no dressing at all, the burger had no lettuce, tomato or second patty that I paid for, as well, the bottom bun was already falling apart from sogginess by the time it got home, I love less than 10min from the restaurant. The fries were so undercooked they were barely edible. The spinach dip was about a two ounce portion, enough for about 6 chips. Finally the French onion soup came with two tiny sticks of garlic bread that were burnt black on one side. The manager's response?  "Not her problem" Disclaimer: did order through an outside delivery company that ive used over 20 times. However we clarified that the order was correctly placed with the restaurant and that should not effect the quality of the food

Red Robin' is like a favorite armchair - comfortable and reliable, with no attitude.  Downtown is filling up with lots of high -end,  designer restaurants, that are OK to visit once in a while, as a treat. But how much am I really willing to pay for someone else's decor?  Red Robin's maintains a relaxed,  comfortable environment and gourmet burgers at a reasonable price.  With endless pop and fries, no one walks away hungry or disappointed.  My whiskey burger was stacked so high, I used a fork and knife to cut it down to size. I love the classic whiskey sauce and the bacon and crispy onions put this burger over the top. It's hard to pick a favorite,  but this is one I like to turn to when I can't decide. My only complaint is that the bun falls apart too easily under the weight of the burger. They should consider a better quality bun.

Sorry to say that but it was a horrible experience. One of the worst burgers I've ever had. We couldn't even finish it. It didn't taste like burger but like the toppings on it which had a very strong tastes. If you're looking for a good place for burgers do not try that one. Service was very nice though.

Dropped by this location which was near my hotel (Hyatt Regency) just after a long day of travel. Was super tired and hungry, so wanted something I was familiar with. Place was ok...food was good, but somehow I feel like Red Robins in the US I have been to were much better. Service was, "meh"; nothing to really rave about. Not that I was expecting to be super wow-ed but expected a little better.

Excellent customer service!!  I have to be honest I frequent the down town location it has a great roof top patio (will try and snag a picture my next visit).   They also have a great happy hour!!! Tasty appies and weekly cocktail specials.  I rate Red Robin as a much better happy hour location than Cactus Club and better food than Earls hands down.  I always eat the Terriyaki Chicken burger.  A juicy perfectly cooked chicken breast with a sweet pineapple ring on top.  It is a messy burger but so worth it!!! Of course Red Robin offers bottomless fries and other sides.  Recently I am on a restricted diet and Red Robin is more than accommodating.  Having the vegetarian fajitas sub lettuce for tortillas, and guacamole for the sour cream and cheese.  The portion is so large I have to take half home.   This place is perfect for children, birthdays, catching the game and happy hour.

The burger here are pretty good. My Favorite is the Mediterranean Burger and the guacamole burger.  I don't know if this place is considered a diner anymore. THe milkshake here is awesome. But its a better deal if you order the bigger size because it comes with unlimited refills and same with the lemonade and other drinks. Another thing, I like here is the unlimited fries refills. Yummy :-)

Food was decent but that was about it.  Sat on the rooftop on a nice sunny day & every time the wind blew it smelled like urine.  We thought we would move a few tables over and was scolded by the hostess "if you're gonna change seats you have to tell me"  we explained why we changed seats and she once again with an attitude said we should have told her.  Piss poor attitude and service to match the piss smell!

Red Robin has been one of my fave go-to burger joints for casual dining over the years. This location overlooks Robson Street and has a great view of all the hustle & bustle that goes on along Vancouver's famous downtown shopping street.  I have been here countless times over the years and have tried many different menu items, but 2 items stand out as my most loved: the popcorn shrimp, and the Royal Red Robin burger. The popcorn shrimp is such a delicious bite-sized appetizer to snack on that it'll be all gone before you even notice! The Royal Red Robin burger has everything I love in a burger: beef, bacon, cheese, and egg! I mean, how can you even go wrong with that?  I love the fact that the fries are thick cut & refillable as many times as you want. Bottomless fries food coma.. Mmmm! The shakes here taste pretty decent too. I recommend getting the larger size as this gives you the remainder that's inside the large shake canister, in addition to what gets poured out to fill your glass. Overall, a great place to grab a chill meal at lunch or after work downtown!

Worst service, waited over 20 minutes and the server saw us and walked by several times and didn't stop, even when he saw we were done with the menus. Wasn't even busy, and there were lots of servers standing around. Disappointing since we go there lots  but after that I don't think we will. Super rude :(

A fun casual setting for birthdays and whatnot. Solid burgers and endless fries. Just make sure you stick with fries, as my brocolli was overcooked and browning. My only complaint is that quality control of food was all over the place (how can my side be so much worse than my burger?). We stayed for about 3 hours and they were champs about it. Shoutout to the waiter who brought us muff dives when I ordered for a mystery shots.

The two hostesses didn't take my name down (just the number of people) when I came in and seemed to be immersed in their own conversation. I just assumed this was normal until they noticed they started seating groups who came in after us. Promptly left. Thanks for wasting my time.

Thank you to Simon S for the heads up on RR's birthday club.  I came for a meal this week before the Whitecaps game with coupon in hand for my free b-day burger. This was my first visit to any Red Robin, and I found the place filled with families.  You have to walk up some steps to get to the restaurant, but it is quite visible from Robson street.  As you crest the steps you'll be in their patio area, which is quite large, and just through the doors takes you into the main dining area. Service was a little cold to start as there wasn't anyone to greet me, and I had to wait a few minutes before someone came over.  They have several TV screens inside but they are all small and not viewing friendly.  As much as I wanted to watch the Jays game, I opted for a seat on the patio instead.   My server came over quickly to introduce herself and detail the drink specials.  Of note, the $4 Shocktop cocktail sounded particularly good.  She took my coupon and showed me which burgers on the menu were eligible for the promotion.  I appreciated her genuinely helpful suggestions to help make up my mind.   No more than ten minutes after I'd ordered, my salmon burger arrived.  I liked the presentation of the meal.  The two burger halves were separated and on one of the buns there was a large dollop of coleslaw and red onion.  It's supposed to have tartar sauce and cilantro-lime dressing, but I couldn't really taste them. I wished the burger had more of a distinct flavour, as the plain salmon was what shone through - the burger was just OK..  As for the fries, they were aesthetically pleasing and nicely salted but strangely they were not all the same temperature nor were they all that fresh.  It was a small serving of fries, maybe only  fifteen or twenty at the very most,.  I would have ordered more had the waitress come to ask as they do advertise "bottomless steak fries" with their meals. The waitress was wholly absent after serving the meal.  My coupon might explain that, or perhaps it was getting busier inside.  I was a little surprised given how warm and friendly she was before I'd placed my order.  I found the patio nice and quiet, but for the 'safe/inoffensive' music playing quietly on the speakers and the traffic driving past. I'll admit - I'm not a big fan of chain restaurants to begin with.  Overall, I found Red Robin to be nothing fancy.  I probably wouldn't take a date there for anything other than a drink or two, and certainly it wouldn't be my first choice to impress.  It seems like a safe choice for families looking for a decent sit-down meal.
Clean, full house, good service BUT mushrooms weren't grilled on the burger. Tasted more like, heated and put on top of patty. Nice place to people watch
Restaurant with a great view of Robson Street and a perfect place for a bite after shopping.  The burgers are great and they come with bottomless fries!

Pretty good place  to escape the rain and people watch above Robson St.  Oh the burgers are huge btw.  Join  the Red Robin  Red Royalty card online.  Free  Burger on your  Birthday  $4 daily  cocktail deals are also  a bonus.

Super nice! I strongly recommend the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger, with cheddar. It's a classic burger, but done really really well. Some interesting craft beers in tap, I especially enjoyed the Goose Island IPA. Nice decor, really nice staff, I recommend this place.
One of my favourite go to places in Vancouver. My Sautéed shroom burger and my son's cod were perfect but our fries were extremely dry. Service was excellent.  Still love the Freckled Lemonade.

Came here with a birthday coupon (free burger). Ordered the cod burger and bacon cheeseburger with one poutine substitution. Burgers were good as expected. Cod was fried perfectly and burger was juicy and flavourful. Prices decent ($10-$12). Fries were disappointing - they were dry and chewy. I always remembered them to be hot, crunchy on the outside and moist inside. Not today :( The poutine substitution is only $1.99, but was really sad (see pic). Two big globs of chunky gravy with stale curds. Would not recommend. Service is always nice and attentive. Atmosphere is loud and I remembered why it's been so long since my last visit - screaming kids. I'd come back maybe but only with a coupon of some sort and at a more adult friendly hour.

The first thing you see is how much of literally everything there is on the wall. Road signs, Andy Warhol quotes, Sports on TV, an old school bar, and full sized windows. The first question you ask is "how is this restaurant actually still here?!," and with the closing of the Broadway location it is a fair and legitimate question. Red Robins is trapped in a decade where snarky ad copy and ridiculous portions were the trend, but now it's almost like they want to be cool ironically.  My favourite piece of ad copy: "smirnoff ice: the start of a good thing." Like I literally don't know a single good thing that has ever started with a smirnoff ice.  I actually do appreciate the awesome service, the bottomless sides, cheap beer, and decent burger. I feel like they want me to like this place even more, but in the irony of ironies, as someone who likes "discovering" weird locations, I'm more inclined to give it snark.

As a tourist visiting downtown I appreciate a quality meal without the sky high prices. It was comfortable, food came quick. And it's in a GREAT location. Shop around downtown and pop in for  bottlomless fries :)
My boyfriend and I eat here frequently, always great customer service, great food, for good prices! Servers are always friendly and talkative. Fave restaurant!
Good place for burgers if you want to chill on a table and have a good view of Robson St. Food and drinks are good. Milkshakes are great.

This is my first time ive been to a red robins. long story short in one word: Meh.  long version: we met the friendly greeter at the door and seated promptly who handed our menus. he was all smiles!   i ordered the Bleu Ribbon burger while my friend ordered the "sriracha burger" (forgot the exact name) and the cheese sticks starter. the burgers include bottomless fries which is nice. fries were very under seasoned, but nothing that table seasoning salt cant fix. cheese sticks portion is pretty small for the price you pay for. they tasted good though! Bleu ribbon burger was SO GOOD. tangy and flavorful. like, out of this world good.  "sriracha burger" was smaller in portion size and tasted OK. my friend still regretted buying it. our server was all smiles and service was only a eye contact and a "hello!" away. they asked how our meal was every so often too. great. on the other hand, our other server promised to come back with fries when i asked but never came. same server asked if i was ready to pay as i was still obviously eating which was kinda rude. the tables were stickier than I'm used to. at least the washrooms were clean. typical american style atmosphere. ceiling tv's to watch a sports game. wide windows so you can see downtown streets from the second floor makes for a nice view. plastered on the wall are some western style decor that gives this place some personality. Sure, i'll come back here again but it won't be my first choice. Wish i researched about the food menu sooner. now i know what NOT to get. hopefully next time the service quality won't be so inconsistent.

The burgers in Red Robin are very delicious! This are real burgers which are much better than Mc Donald's and they have many different kinds. They also have different salads. My favorite is the chicken tender salad. For drinks, my favorite is fleckled lemonade with strawberries because it's very tasty!The service is very friendly. They come all the time and ask if everything is ok, if you like to have  more fries (for the same price) or if you like to refill the drink (it's also free). The prices are good for that what they get. The atmosphere is nice, they have picture on the wall and they have music.The restaurant is on Robson street and it's very easy to find.I brought different friends there and all of them liked it very much!If you like to go with a big group it's better when you make a reservation, because this restaurant is very busy. It is a excellent restaurant!

Such a great experience! We have been back 3 times in the last 3 weeks because we love this location so much.  My boyfriend and I started our meal off with "adult"  freckled lemonades, as they call them and mine was a bit strong. Our wonderful waiter (I think his name was Adrian) asked me if i was enjoying my drink and I told him it was a bit strong so he offered to get me an extra cup of lemonade (and he filled it with the strawberries too! yum). It helped dilute the drink a bit which i very much appreciated. When we ordered our food our server was very keen to give us suggestions and was helping me decide what to eat, he was very knowledgeable about the menu. And the food came out SO quick! He was very attentive too. When our fries were looking a bit empty he offered to go get us some more and came back very shortly with a big basket of the bottomless fries. Sometimes I have found at Red Robin in the past that they are quite stingy with their "bottomless" fries but Adrian wasnt stingy at all! It was a fantastic eating experience and I recommend everyone to go try this location!

Amazing location, arguably the best DT intersection for action & shopping.  Thanks goodness that TGIF closed here years ago lol. The championship burger for me is the Banzai burger--that pineapple sure is something.  Maybe the every 3rd time I may switch to the Shrooms or Whiskey bbq burger. but i don't care for the fries, just not my thing w/ these wedges.  Guess i just prefer the saltiness of McDick's lol. Great corner view, & plenty of seating, rarely have to wait long.
Great place to hang out with friends. Food is fairly priced and the meals come in big portions! I was also able to take the rest of my meal home!

I had never been to a red robin before so i was sort of expecting just burger and fries, but i was happily wrong. the food was tasty and our waiter was great. I love the location too! You get a view of the city while you eat.

Came by for some burgers and good times. Strangely enough, it wasn't that busy, even on a weekday at noon.  The patio was completely empty. One of my favourite things about this location is the great view you have of Robson and Thurlow.  You can watch everyone slave away in the rat race while you enjoy your food.  Oh, and there's a great covered patio out back. Today I had a Red Chili Chili Burger.  They suggest that you use a knife and fork, and they are absolutely right.  The chili was quite heavy, with plenty of diced red onions.  I've also had other burgers here, but the one that always sticks out is the Whiskey RIver BBQ Burger.  The sauteed onions are to die for. I've had their strawberry lemonade and this thing is good.  However, you can also tell it's been sweetened quite a bit, so hopefully you don't end up like Steve Jobs after having a few of these.  Bottomless drinks always feel good.  The staff are quite good with the refills.  They give you a replacement before you actually run out. I don't come by here too often because parking sucks (aka non-existent), but on a workday, it's a nice change of pace.

It is what it is.  Mind you I don't eat beef so I usually just get the crispy chicken burger / another kind of chicken sandwich. My husband always orders the veggie burger as a replacement for a beef patty on one of their crazy burgers - he enjoys this a lot.  Service, however, is usually pretty bad. On multiple occasions we have been ignored for long stretches of time, servers won't make eye contact so they don't have to acknowledge us. On one occasion I think the manager finally caught on that absolutely no one was helping us and he stepped it up and took over and did an excellent job.

Not sure where to begin... Not good, not all...wings were terrible, small,  withered I've had better frozen made in an oven......not spicy at all...burger was dry and tasteless..... Huge amount of bread, giant ciabatta roll.....disappointment.  why anyone would go here when there's so much better food, steps away is beyond me. I won't be back....

Good burger with a fire grilled meat patty that tastes great but,there were too many ingredients in the basic burger: sauce, lettuce, tomatoes, onions pickles and relish. Hopefully the meat had a strong taste so you could still feel it.  Talking about the meat, although the taste was good it wasn't of great quality, it was a bit chewy and it was well done by default while I prefer meat medium.

Came here for a late lunch with some friends and received some exceptional service. The hostess was efficient and we were seated quickly upon arrival. Our server was also very friendly.  The food was so-so. Don't get me wrong, it was good-- It just wasn't an oh-my-gosh-this-is-the-greatest-thing-I've-ever-tasted type of food. It was kind of what you would expect from a typical family-friendly chain restaurant, maybe like Ihop or Whitespot. The food was good and heart-warming, and the service was awesome. The bottomless fries are great too. They make their fries pretty well. They're these thick sort of wedge-like cuts and ohhh mannnn so delicious. The bottomless factor also adds to the deliciousness.

Red Robin calls for no occasion. Could you ever go wrong with burgers, Steak cut fries and smoothies? Probably not.  Up a flight of stairs, tucked away in a dodgy corner from a fast take-out White Spot is our downtown Red Robin. Despite it's unimpressive entrance, the interior makes every adult feel like a not-so-grown-up adult again! All the times we've been there, the service has been quite fast. Even during rush hours and special holidays, the seating moves reasonably quickly. A new discovery made here during my last visit is that reservations are welcome. The no-reservations impression must have come from somewhere, but it is gladly mistaken.  The most impressive burger by far, in my opinion, has to be the Whiskey River BBQ Burger. That is with the exception that your taste buds agree completely with BBQ sauce. Loaded with onion straws -- my favourite! -- and smothered with smokey, sweet BBQ sauce, the Whiskey River is the burger to try if you have not! The rest of the burgers on the menu are probably exceptionally delightful in their own way, but I can only tell so much about the one burger because I am boring like that; I get the same burger every time.  The next highlight is bottomless fries. Not just any fries... Steak cut fries! They have this Red Robin house seasoning on every table that is to kill for. The seasoning is a red-ish colour, contained in a Red Robin shaker bottle. Some may disagree with my verdict, because the smell and taste of the added spices are quite strong. Here's another tip: Honey Mustard with Poppy Seeds!!! I am a sucker for sauce. I love sauce. Very much. This has got to be the best honey mustard I've ever tasted! Be it the poppy seeds or simply my sauce addiction, we can all agree that you have GOT TO TRY IT!  It's a shame they stopped giving away the humongous slice of dessert for birthdays now. It was a treat for everyone to visit on their birthdays and be humiliated, standing on a chair while they announce your age to the entire restaurant, all in the spirit of knowing that there's a huge slice of dessert at the end of the tunnel.

I have to say this, their food is CONSISTENT across all locations. This is what you want out of chain restaurants... knowing exactly what you're getting. Came here a few days ago as I was craving a Royal Burger. I've always liked their burgers and this was no different.  Our waiter was ok. He had a rookie shadowing him but we didn't mind. The waiter took our order and the food came out fast enough. He was a little hard to find to get refills and the bill. The patio is a nice place to eat when the sun is out and the location really is pretty awesome.

Red Robin, I will never hate you. Others have tried to convince me otherwise, but I shun their negativity. From my first visit to the old Thurlow and Alberni location, I was hooked. Back then, I had only lived here for a short time, and it was my first restaurant experience in Vancouver. I was 17. It took care of of my teen business like you wouldn't believe. I remember my first order. A Big-mouth burger with fries, Pepsi and a Monster mud pie. The Pepsi and fries were bottomless. I was speechless.  I grew up, I progressed into university, got used to enjoying their hot wings, onion rings, milkshakes, then onto beer, the gooey cheese sticks, the southwestern salad, fajitas, and pretty much tried everything else on the menu over the years. Nothing's changed at Red Robin. They'll get some flack for it, but the decor is still relatively the same. I don't mind it. It's a fond reminder of a more care-free time. Perhaps you'd had to have experienced the joys of a Red Robin trip as a young'un to appreciate the predictability and safeness of the menu 20+ years later. It's a staple. I always know that there'll be no surprises. If there's a problem, they'll try to fix it. I love bringing my little niece here, and I love bringing my parents here. It's a no-brainer when those types of demographics are at play.  Apart from a couple of bad experiences relating solely to the inexperience of individual staff, or forgivable mistakes in the kitchen, there have been no major shortfalls over the years in the customer experience. It's not fine dining, but it's not without an attempt at good service either. Think of it as a training ground for young staff, and with a consistent menu. If you need a reason to change your mind, here are a few: The Onion Rings. Yes, capital letters. I don't think anyone does it better. Actually I'll stand behind this. I think they are the best in town, bar none. And they make me giggle out loud when that tower arrives at the table. The patio on Oak Street is amongst the best in the area. A variety of burgers that few places can match. This coming from a not-so-big fan of burgers. Bottomless pop and fries. The menu has been re-incarnated in a slightly shrunken form several times since those first visits I made. I did not like the removal of the Eggs Broadway burger a decade ago, but so be it. Most restaurants make much more dramatic changes over that period of time. As for the appeals to renovate, be careful what you wish for. Do you really want Red Robin to become the next Cactus Club? I say tidy it up, keep dusting off those airbrushed posters of  Duck Tales and the Lamborghini Countach and if it ain't broke, don't fix it.

Came a second time to this location yesterday and it was fantastic! Our food was great and so was our servers. We had a trainee and and trainer waitress and they were so lovely and friendly. I'd like to point out that the burgers were much much much better! A lot of us got the arctic cod burger I believe and it was delicious and large! Much better than last visit. Also their menu seemed to have changed a bit I think. More updated. Anyways, I shall come here more often!

Oh man, if you knew how many calories were in a burger, you'd be sad-faced too. But if you can look past that, Red Robin is a delicious burger joint and well worth the $10 meal.  Located in the busy area of Robson & Thurlow, this place is great for people watching - especially with a bottomless freckled lemonade if you're up for the $5 splurge. And for a share starter, nothing brings more delight to the eyes of old and young alike as the onion ring tower (campside bbq sauce is the best!).  Burgers here are DELISH. The menu has several staples (including the Royal Robin burger with a fried egg), but my favourites are the bonzai, california, or whiskey river burger. Service here is awesome as well, they add onion straws to my burger at no extra charge and they can bring it out on a plate and cut in half for you if you know you'll be taking some of it home. Bottomless fries (the fatty kind though, I'm more a fan of thin fries), or a side salad (not bottomless) completes your meal. Those not looking for beef can also choose from the veggie patty options, or the chicken or salmon burgers. Or if you're really not feeling burgers, they've got salads, fajitas, chicken fingers, and more.  The place is big, roomy, but really busy during lunch on the weekends. I recommend this place to visitors who are looking for some regular burgers or fast food. :) It's a safe option every time, and good value for a filling meal in downtown.
Good customer service. They know how to take care of their customers. Efficient service, good food.
Food okay.  Service was extremely slow even with the place not crowded at 3pm in the afternoon.
Amazing Burgers. Blue cheese burger is too die for. Free unlimited French fried. Good location. Upbeat service.

The burgers were very good. There are many to choose from, a variety of ingredients and the meat tastes like it should. Bottomless fries were not so good however... If I go again I will order other side to the burger. The service made us feel at home. We even forgot there sunglasses and were very helpful, they offered to call or write an email in case they appeared (luckily, we found them afterwards). I don't usually rate 4 star a burger place, but extra star for service.

Another birthday deal :) I got the Crispy Arctic Cod Burger (~$14) on a lettuce bun. The meal also comes with bottomless fries. I'd never had a lettuce burger before, so I decided to give it a try. There was a lot of water between the pieces of lettuce, and thus the burger was messier than usual. It tasted quite good though--I will likely opt for the lettuce bun again in the future. The cod was also very tasty, though I think some extra tartar sauce would have made it better. The fries were decent, but I didn't ask for a refill. The service was good. We got seated right away. Although our food took a while to come out, our waiter apologized for the wait without being prompted and updated us on the status.

Comfort food. No, it's nothing spectacular, but they serve up very good burgers with all you can eat fries (even tho by the time I'm done with the burger, I never even finish the first round of fries). There's a decent sized beer menu and full bar cocktail menu, if memory serves. Every time I've been here, the service has been great. Staff are super friendly, even at the busiest times. Speaking of busy, it can get really noisy inside.  One thing I experienced that I thought was weird is that sometimes, that handheld credit card machine displays in french and there's no way to change it. Sorry. I don't speak/read french. Oddly enough, when I switched to a different card, the display was in English. Quirky. I do kinda hate that it's upstairs, only because when it's raining (as if often does in Vancouver) I always feel like I'm going to slip on the stairs. And, yeah, the elevator smells bad. Thankfully, it's a quick ride.

I used to go here all the time as a teenager. They have always had good burgers and fries, as well as an awesome cheesecake!   I recently tried their spinach and artichoke dip which left much to be desired. It was to runny, when it should be thicker and made with more cheese . The clucks and greens haven't changed much but aren't as great as other chicken strips such as the ones at cactus. The fries are still good and their tartar sauce is amazingly good. It tastes pretty close to McDonald's tartar sauce. The cheesecake is fabulous though they are stingy with the fruit topping. We also ordered the mud pie, which was not good. They've changed it. It no longer has peanut butter on it.  It's just icecream and chocolate. You're better off eating a Dairy Queen icecream cake because this was not good AT ALL. Going back to eat here was a little nice bit of nostalgia but I won't be going back anytime soon.  Though the cheesecake makes it tempting.

Haven't been here for a long time.  Came with a group of friends.  Ordered the beef dip with unlimited fries.  Would rather get the beef dip from White Spot.  It wasn't that tasty amd seemed a bit soggy.  Service was ok.

Coming to Red Robin's is always a treat. Nothing stellar, but a good sense of nostalgia. We started off sharing the onion ring tower and an order of the cheese sticks. The cheese sticks featured pieces of jalapeno peppers, adding a nice kick. Not a big fan of the plum sauce they paired with though! Always make sure you order or share a milkshake when you're here! This time I ordered the "Nananana Moomoo" milkshake. I honestly couldn't say it with a straight face while ordering it, but it definitely didn't disappoint! Although slightly heavy on the banana syrup, but it wasn't too heavy with my meal. I ordered the gardenburger with garlic fries as my main. I was actually impressed by how full of flavor the veggie burger patty was! I've been to countless burger joints where veggie burgers taste like a soulless being. I was very happy with the texture and spices used! Definitely not a place where I'd come often, but was nice to just spoil myself with a fat furger once in a while!

Came here while we were in Vancouver on the day before our Alaskan cruise.  Food was just OK.  Waitress seemed nice, but then disappeared.  Prices seemed expensive for the quality of the food.  I paid extra to add avocado to my salad and got just a few teeny slices.  If you get a table near one of the large windows facing the street, it's a great view and perfect for people-watching.

The best place to get American comfort food in Vancouver. This is a city that doesn't offer many big American chain restaurants, so Red Robin does a fairly good job to cover that area, even though it has barely any competition. The quality of the food is much superior to White Spot, for example. The place is usually crowded with tourists or large groups celebrating birthdays, so expect some noise, but you probably won't need to wait for a table for two. All the burgers and shakes are delicious and worth your money, and the bottomless fries (regular, garlic or yam) are always a good deal. If you order a dipping sauce for your fries (the garlic aioli is great), don't forget to ask for a refil -- if your waiter is in a good mood he might give you at least one.

If you like burgers, Red robin woud be a good place to go. I love it that they have a protein style option for all their burgers! I can't go back to bun. I haven't had one bad experience with their customer service, they always look so positive and happy, kinda scary haha.

I went here the other day to try out Red Robin's burger. When I left, I just felt a meh vibe. There was this one instance where a server completely ignored me when I asked if our ketchup bottle could be refilled. For instance, the banana moo-moo didn't taste that good in my opinion. Could feel the banana chunks too. In terms of the burger I ordered, I had the Red Robin Royal Burger. The burger was quite big but the bun crumbled very easily I found. To be honest, I didn't really taste the bacon that much in the burger. The fries were nice and hot though which was the main highlight really! All in all, I was kind of expecting to be blown out of my seat. If you're looking for a quick fix, I guess this is the place to go. Just don't expect anything special/

I came here for my free birthday burger & fries - no strings attached!! The staff is very attentive and incredibly sweet. Menu has a large selection of burgers.  I would probably have to try more, if they appealed, to give a better review on them.  I chose the guacamole bacon burger.  It was just okay.  I wouldn't have purchased it for $11.50 but it was tasty enough.  The fries, which I don't normally like, were the best fries I've ever had!!!!  I'd go back for these things.  I added a side of baby carrots & dip.  Fries tasted great in the ranch dip ;) Their drink menu is extensive and amazing!!  It's clearly the front runner for those that love fun cocktails as much as I do.  And spiked milkshakes!!  Kahlua amaretto shake is amazing :)  Excellent prices for drinks.   This could be my new favourite patio hot spot if I can convince my friends to go!  I also purchased their tiki tumbler which I've wanted for the last 20 years.  Soooo happy!!

After a long trip from Seattle to BC we were in a mood for a burger and fries and thankfully there was a Red Robin close to our hotel so we jetted over. The staff seemed really busy even though no one was in the place at 3pm-ish and very inattentive. We actually got served our burgers with no napkins or silverware and then finally they brought over one napkin which as you know we needed more but never got more. I also didn't get a refill which is never good. BUT I'm giving it 3 stars because the food was good. We both tried the new burgers Pepper something which were really great and the fries were great. She had the yam fries and I had the regular steak fries.  Overall it was an ok experience, service is for sure lacking. It was our first time to Canada so maybe that's normal there, I don't know. Different culture possibly. We really enjoyed our stay though and can't wait to go back.

This is the worst excuse for food and service in Downtown Vancouver. Our server had the most severe dandruff I have ever witnessed. The Poutine we had added to the burger tasted like it was powdered gravy. What a stain on Robson Street. The female manager on at the time was completely useless as well.  Stay clear.

Everybody loves this place! Always come to this location in Robson Street, many times already especially on my Birthday!   Best part of this, everyone loves the bottom less fries!   but I like the yam fries better.... I avoid fried foods and the oil makes my stomach pain sometimes. I have tried mushroom burger, veggie and salmon is my favorite. ... Last time I was in there this August with a friend. Awesome place but crazy crazy busy most of times but night time is always very busy!

Meh I'm really not a fast food fan, so this review is probably biased. Although the burgers were "gourmet", the service and the presentation were not. I would still eat it, just not some place that I would rush back to

In general I enjoy the upscale burger venues. However, I really can't abide poor service in a sit down establishment. It was after 2 PM and the place was less than one quarter full. I chose to sit inside as I had enough sun for the day already. As a single, I was asked if I wanted to sit at the bar which was fine by me. Little did I know it would take 10 minutes for the bartender to even get to me to take my order. A little too much chatting up the waitresses.  Finally came and took my drink order. I have a a think for salted caramel so I couldn't resist their salted caramel shake. I wish I had. They've got the salted part down a little too well, but if I hadn't seen the drizzle for caramel colored syrup on the top, I would never have guessed this was supposed to be a caramel shake.  My burger took another 15 minutes to arrive and it was pretty good. The place is well located (off Robson) although it takes a little work to find the stairs that lead to the second floor venue. The bar seems well stocked for a burger restaurant and I only hope the service is better for the next customer

Absolutely a fan of this place! I've came here a couple of times for friends' birthdays and smaller gatherings. The food is great and there's so many burgers to choose from. Recently tried their mediterranean chicken burger with a lemonade, it was great but I still prefer their crispy chicken burger and mac and chesse. Servers are really friendly and they also provide free dessert if it's your birthday that day!!

Red Robin what every happened to you. I used to love coming with you with my friends. Sure there are other better places in the city to dine at, however, you were THE place for me to get my burger on. The burgers are sub par now, some downsizing in food, customer service has gone down. They still have some awesome things on the menu, however, the calories are a lot and on the surface can be very deceiving. They do publish their nutritional information which is very helpful at least.

I love love Red Robins especially the US ones. We were soo sad when the Broadway one closed. The food and service are decent here but it smells gross at this one.  My favourite is still the 5 alarm burger and who doesn't love unlimited fries! Don't forget to order fries to start while you think about what you want.  This one only get 2/5 because it just doesn't match up to the other ones. Down to Bellingham we go.

I love this place.  Good burgers, good view of Robson st., unlimited fries, fast, friendly service and decent pricing.  This is a 4 star favorite in my books.  Also, the free meal on your Birthday is awesome as not a lot of places do that anymore.

I've been back several times since my initial review, and it's every bit as good. I do have a little story to share: We came here a couple nights ago, and we had not been having a good night at all. Our usual waiter, Arlo, had been promoted to a manager, so we ended up with someone different this time. Arlo saw us and came by to say hello. He noticed that we were a bit upset (nothing to do with Red Robin), and after our meal, he brought us something to cheer us up. It wasn't anything extravagant, but we certainly appreciated it all the same. You can say what you want about the food, atmosphere, or what have you, but you can't beat service like that.

Woww! Bottomless fries!!!!  Their entrance is on the 2nd floor, and you can get there by taking the elevator or the stairs. The elevator smell like homeless people... The seats and the floors are quite dirty. It looks like they wipe the tables quickly, pushing all the crumbs on the floor and on the CHAIRS.  For me to sit here was very uncomfortable. EW. GERMS. But looking pass that, the menu looks okay. The poutine turned out okay. The calamari was okay. Our server checked up on us almost every 5-10 minutes!! WHY? (We were repacking our suitcase here in the corner though, perhaps she was suspicious?) But she was nice too.

This place is in a prime location, totally busy and under staffed on a Saturday night. I was sort of turned off by the smell in there, so I did a small order to start, the basket of popcorn shrimp. My Bf ordered a burger with fries. He said it didn't really hit the spot. There was a lot of shrimp in my basket, but I also wasn't satisfied. The soda is always on point here, never flat. The service wasn't great either. 4 hostesses stood by the doorway giggling loudly, while customers piled up at the door. Maybe it just wasn't a good night. Lots of other places to go on Robson, for a good burger or to eat after a day of shopping.

Fantastic place with great burgers, bottomless pop and fries. Service is good and at a convenient location. Whats not to like? There are always plenty of seats so you never have to wait too long. The music is not too loud and plenty of tv screens to catch a game. Prices are decent and the menu has a good variety of items. I've been told that the milkshakes are not too bad either.  Our waitress was fantastic and I never had to ask for a refill. She just kept coming back with drink. Can't fault them yet!
Awesome burgers ,great shakes , quick service and decent location , no parking however and it can get very loud and very busy. But hey it's dt!!

I have eatin at this place for many years now and one thing for sure about this place is it is consistent. Burgers are always good and the price is fair and the service is normally great.  What I like most about this place though is the atmosphere. I love catching up with a friend here or going with a group of people.  Always feel relaxed and comfortable.

This place has great chain American cheeseburgers. The night that I went, the place was busy with a line, so the hostess offered me the bar rather than wait, since I was just one. The bartender was great! Very attentive, but not in-your-face. The food came out surprisingly fast (for how busy the place was).The bottomless fries are fun, whether you get a refill or not. I can't say I'd take a date to Red Robin, but it was a great stop to get a good burger!

My god, am I obsessed with Red Robin, or what? It's consistently delicious and an absolute must if you're craving the chicken fingers/burger and fries sort of meal. All meals with fries come with ENDLESS FRIES. That's right, ENDLESS FRIES. Be prepared to take in billions of calories, but I'm telling you that it's worth it. They have this seasoning on each of the tables, please make sure you put some on your fries and meal, because it's just so damn delicious.

Red Robin in general gets 2 stars, but this location gets 4 stars! Pros? -AMAZING PEOPLE WATCHING -Good food and drinks -Fast service -DID I MENTION AMAZING PEOPLE WATCHING? Cons? -It's still a Red Robin, and therefore not amazing
I have a lot of positive memories visiting this Red Robin with friends. The staff have always been welcoming and accommodating. The food is always hearty and tasty. Love the endless steak fries.

The burgers that you order looks exactly like the on the menu. I their dipping sauce for the fries. I usually get the one with the poppy seeds. I usually get the beef burgers and they come with unlimited fries. There are burgers out there with too much tomato and it creates a soggy unpleasant taste.They have the right amount of moisture. Everything was to my expectation. I think that they should give you the burger right when it's hot, because that's when it's the best.

never coming here again. Horrible experience for being in Canada for the first time. it was small cluttered. they took forever to give any type of service. WTF only one guy was considerate. but the girls there and the rest gave SUCH HORRIBLE SERIVE. should've stayed in the US and made them give me burgers and fries. They didn't even ask how i wasted my burger, i asked no tomato... yet i got two big slices of tomatoes. Took for ever to bring my the rest of my fries. Ontop of that took forever to bring me my bill what was their problem. Such inconsiderate pricks, They seemed to care a lot more about their coworkers that just got off sitting by bar than the actual costumers. such disappointment.

Oh man I love this place. In my opinion the best burgers! The place is perfect located with a view on Robson Street. The decor reminds me on a modern diner and I really enjoy to sit around here. The staff is young, motivated and always very very nice and smiling. The Burgers are awesome. So much to choose from and you always get bottomless fries with it. By the way the fries are great too. :-). You get your Burger in a little red basket which is really lovely. My favorite is the Burger with a beef patty, sautéed mushrooms and onions. Delicious! You can make all the Burgers a Monster by adding another beef patty. They also have great desserts, Their milk shakes are very good and the cakes are so great (very big!!! We shared a Mud Mountain pie, or what the name was again, with 3 persons.) Oh and try the Appetizers!! Especially the Onion Ring Tower!

I'm usually not a fan of chain restaurants, but Red Robin is good at what it specializes. It sits in a niche that I'm more comfortable with - not trying to be all hip & happening like Cactus Club, Earls, etc. The atmosphere is warm and friendly, and it serves a good burger - what's not to like? A surprise winner on the menu is..... *drum roll please* French Onion Soup!!! It's a strong competitor to FOS served at fancy shmancy French restaurants, and in fact, better than some.  Oh, have I mentioned the bottomless steak fries yet? A guaranteed delicious food coma.

My server was nice and prompt. I liked their burger menu coz they have many different varieties to choose from on their menu. Would be nice to have a bit more lighting coz it felt dark even during the afternoon.
I have to this place twice. Both times with large groups of people and we were taken care of almost right away. Food is good Friendly atmosphere. BOTTOMLESS FRIES!!!

Yikes... I can't keep doing this.  I can't keep eating at places I hate because my friends want to. When I was a teeny-ager many moons ago, this was it. This was the place to go... I don't know why. We came to meet some friends who were already mid-meal. We sat... and sat some more... the server did not materialize for some time and it was only to tell us he was going home. Okay, but then he stayed and kept serving other tables for a good hour.  We ordered from the server who took over and when we got out food, we had to wait an extra long time for cutlery. I was okay because I just had a burger, I just needed a napkin. My husband on the other hand needed at least a fork to eat his lasagna. I would have been okay with wrestling the fork out of my friend's hand who was still using it, but he would not be okay with that.  The food was okay. My burger was okay. I can't/won't eat that many fries so the draw of bottomless doesn't really fly with me. They have lots of good non-alcoholic drinks... I dunno. I just... I think this place would be awesome in the summer because of the huge patio.

I ordered take out for my roomie and I and showed up about 15 minutes lator. The place was total chaos. I walked in and the hostess looked at me, I informed her that I had ordered in advance and she said "Go to the bar", so I shrugged off her greeting and headed to the bar. I stood at the bar for 2/3 minutes being passed by several servers, so then I stood at the server station hoping that one of them would at least ask me if I needed anything. When no one bothered, I stopped one of the people behind the bar and asked if I could pay for my take out. He said sure but kept on doing whatever he was doing. A few min lator he came back, took my money and said it'd be a few minutes. He then went back to doing whatever he was doing. I took a seat at a recently vacated table beside the bar and two minutes lator a dishwasher came out and put a tray of glasses on the table beside me. A few minutes lator I received my food and walked out. Got home only to realize that not quite all the order was in the bag and the food was of super poor quality. I will never eat at this chain again and or this location.
Haven't been here in a few years. I thought I give it a try again. The burger seemed smaller then it was before. The food was was just alright but the service was excellent.
SUCH great service here! We were just visiting the area and the waitress was kind enough to tell us all the fun places to go to at night! Will be here again for sure when we are in the area.

My neighborhood haunt of choice. Oh sure, there's the Fogg and Sudds across the street, but I'm willing to go one more block for some Red Robin goodness.  I almost am never dissapointed when I climb the stairs to this place. I usually have one of two things, a red robin classic burger, which has an egg on it and is almost heaven, or the whiskey river chicken burger which is also amazing. You get lots of steak fries, with refills. go great with that coke you're drinking. Service is always good here too. Love coming here.

location: Long Island City, New York, NY
review: Their cheap prices and second floor location offering views over Robson always win me over when I have a sudden pang of hunger shopping Robson. It's cheap sandwiches/burgers & salads and they're generally pretty hearty in size.  The endless fries coupled with that insanely delicious Red Robin seasoning they have will have you strangely craving them shortly after filling yourself up here. Service is surprisingly good for a restaurant of this style and although rather uninspiring the decor is basic and comfortable for a meal after a long day shopping.

I would probably eat here again. The fish sandwich was very well put together, with good veggies protecting the bun from getting soggy, and a tasty tartar sauce. The fish breading was crispy and the fish was firm.  Fries were the large style, if you like that. Sports on the TV, snappy service, and a convenient location rounded out a good dinner.

went here tonight and the burgers were under done...mine was pink and my friends was red(raw) and not even in the middle...it was raw on the edges...both of us have very upset stomachs now...very disappointed!

I had my first burger in 14 years here. Meh.  As a Yelper I have no real excuse for eating in here, it's a chain and a bad chain at that. But it was a typically beautiful Vancouver day (read: hammering rain) and I wanted food without having to go look for it.  I kinda felt like I was a kid again, big booths, plastic menus (and not in the cutesy, kitsch 1950s diner way) and fried foods. The lack of anything remotely vegetarian appealing led me to trying the burger, with blue cheese, crispy onions and bottomless fries. Even in the states, I've not seen bottomless fries. Hello Canada, it's obesity calling!  The burger was fine, oversized and not particularly good meat. Even as a vegetarian I could tell it was gristly, yuck. It was enough to get me back on the veggie wagon. Bad milkshake too. Friendly staff though.
This place is where I actually don't mind breaking my diet and enjoying the shrimp fries :))
Consistent food, great service. Never disappoints, great place to come for a comforting bite and good atmosphere. Too bad they don't have more locations...

Mediocre burgers and unlimited fries. That pretty much sums up Red Robins. My last visit (last ever) was a terrible exhibition of poor service and management. A server spilled salad dressing on my jacket, did not apologize. I confronted the manager and he stumbled to find a wet cloth. No apology from him either. At first he suggested I take it to the dry cleaners and bring back the bill (waste of my time), I finally got him to write off my meal bill. Eek.

Not really sure why I feel it necessary to write something tonight but I think if a place does a good job they should get a prop (insert plug here for  ) Sometimes you just want a burger, in a loud annoying restaurant where at any point the staff could break out into a happy birthday for an unlucky little 8 year old name Timmy (just like in Waiting) Get the Guac and Bacon burger! It is constantly amazing! The four of us split a tower of onion rings, I am not sure if you pay more for the tower but the rings are great, i think they are pre done and not hand made but still very good portion of onion to batter ratio I feel that this burger joint out does some others around the city. Enjoy and keep that burger diaper wrapped tight, it is not there for decoration it is a vital part of the experience.

The menu here is the same as any other Red Robin: gourmet burgers, plus a few other options, like salads, fish and chips, or fajitas. (I was pleased to see potato skins back on the menu.) The burgers are definitely a notch above what you'd find at a fast food place, although the price is much higher, too, so you're probably getting just about the same amount of pleasure per dollar. I will say that the staff here, while just as relentlessly friendly as in other Red Robins, are definitely more on the ball than the staff at the Marine Drive location in North Vancouver. There are stairs to get up to the restaurant level from the Thurlow Street side, but there is also an elevator, for those who have problems with the stairs.

Red Robin is a reasonably priced, mediocre place that is usually convenient and they are consistent if they are nothing else. Not many places along Robson boast a full-sized patio, so we stopped here, ordered mediocre chicken wings, a turkey burger that was fine with bottomless wedge fries, and bottomless ice tea & lemonades, and left satisfied.  Interior is looking very tired. Turnoff - it never feels super-clean.

Red Robin is a classic burger choice. The food is delicious and most importantly these days, reasonably priced! Not to mention the bottomless fries!  Hello? Are you hungry? Go to Red Robin. I have been there extremely hungry, thinking I would probably order 2 more rounds of fries but can rarely barely finish my first. What does that mean? A HUGE EFFING BURGER! The service is also great, out of all the times I've been there, which is a lot, I've probably had only one bad experience. Oh, and try the guacamole burger, its awesome
They have a burger with "Canadian processed cheese." Being the dunce I am, it took me a minute to realize they really meant American Cheese. Oh, Canada...

The words romance and Red Robin are not synonymous.  The words bottomless fries, Tom Selleck  and awesome are.    If you enjoy milkshakes this is also a fairly solid spot.   Decent prices, and a wide selection that will please pretty much anybody Red Robin is surprisingly tasty, with excellent service.  Our server was prompt, knew virtually everything on the menu, and was kind to boot.  I was deeply won over with Funky Town playing in the bathroom.  I don't know, it may just be my love of funk but if I'm washing my hands to one of the best beats in the world the place gets two stars minimum.
Good value on Robson Street at a good price. Consider having your burger with lettuce instead of a bun.

Ok I am right now having a really late lunch with my sister and I am sad to report that it is not vegan friendly at all. The garden burger has cheese in the patty and every salad has meat in it. At least the server knows her stuff, she saved me the trouble of asking. I am going to consume the only healthy option that is vegan: side garden salad.
I went last night there with my friends, although it was so crowded but everything was organized, the service was great , the food was awesome , thanks alot
I'm not a burger woman but if I want to eat a burger I come here! It's a a nice burger with some fresh fries! You can have fries as you want!  I recommend it

The location is great, the food is greasy, the seats are comfy, the tunes are decent, the staff is good, they have televisions, and they have a huge alcohol selection....aka, this is the best place to hang out hungover ever!!! I have only been once since I moved to Van and me and my friend were haggard as shit after a hard night of being fabulous. We wanted something greasy and good and I hadnt had a burger in months! We ventured in here and ate till out hearts content, everything was delicious and even had a mint chocolate milkshake to top it off, yum, yum. after a solid meal and a few drinks my hangover magically disappeared. Not that its only good for hangovers, im sure burger and fries lovers would enjoy the quality food anytime. I just only happen to eat food like this when im hungover so thats my story and im stickin to it....like the onion rings in my stomach.
Still my favorite place for burger in Downtown. Good service, great food and nice view of traffic passing by on Robson.

For my trip to Vancouver, one of the first places we went to eat was Red Robin's. I heard a lot of things about it, so I wanted to experience first hand. For my first visit, I was very pleased. I got bottomless Freckled Lemonade (Strawberry Lemonade), a Poutine and VERY good french onion soup. Everything was DEEE-licious. The employees were VERY nice and very speedy. I would recommend this to anyone in the need of burgers, or basically anything else.

My favorite Red Robin restaurant in Vancouver.   What can I say... great burgers, bottomless fries, bottomless freckled lemonades.  A very friendly family oriented restaurant.  They have excellent customer service and good company policies.  ie:  For your birthday you get a free meal and the employees sing you happy birthday.

Typical modern diner restaurant, kind of like Boston Pizza with the atmosphere but burger oriented. Burgers are very tasty, I love the ones with the greasy battered and fried onion bits! Fries are bottomless, but they don't give many at once so it is really not much different than eating at a pub that gives you mounds of fries on the first serving (which is more than all I can eat, but it is nice to have continuous fresh fries rather than a pile of cold fries left on your plate.

came here a couple of times during the olympics.. just up the street from the CTV booth on robson.. good place to just kick back, and have some food and drinks.. fries are always good and bottomless.. they are thick cut.. my fave burger is the blue ribbon burger (blue cheese and onion straws) and the other burgers are awesome too.. they also have an onion ring tower which is good.

Red Robin is ok. Really, the word that comes to mind when I think of this place is "adequate." It's adequate. The burgers are adequate. The fries are adequate. The service is adequate. The only thing that stands out for me is the strawberry lemonade, which is actually pretty great. But I could probably do that myself at home by cutting up some strawberries and putting them in lemonade, and I just can't seem to think of any other reason to come here instead of, say, White Spot, which is only a few blocks away.
I find it pretty humorous that I had to go to a Red Robin in Canada to figure out that hanging out in their bar while you're trying to kill some time is a pretty fun and reasonably priced experience.
